intro: Fissistigma chrysosericeum, commonly known as the golden-hair fern, is a rare and delicate species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery fronds that are covered in a dense layer of silky, golden-hued trichomes, giving it its common name. The plant thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique appearance makes it a sought-after specimen in botanical gardens and conservation efforts. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires careful cultivation to ensure its survival.
